title: Italian Game
description: Master this classical opening that leads to exciting tactical battles. Perfect for beginners learning opening principles.

moves.comment: Play e4 to occupy the center and open lines for your bishop and queen.
Black plays e5 to contest the center.
Develop your knight to f3 and attack Black’s e5 pawn.
Black defends the e5 pawn and develops their knight.
Play Bc4 to place your bishop on its most active diagonal, targeting Black’s f7 square.
Black mirrors your move and plays Bc5 to develop their bishop.
Play c3 to prepare d4 and strengthen your center.
Black develops another knight and attacks your e4 pawn.
Push d4 to challenge Black’s center and open up the position.
Black captures your pawn on d4.
Recapture on d4 with your c3 pawn to maintain a strong center.
Black checks your king and tries to pin your knight after Nc3.
Block the check by developing your knight to c3.
Black captures your e4 pawn and grabs material.
Castle kingside to bring your king to safety and prepare your rook for central activity.
Black captures your knight on c3.
Recapture on c3 with your b-pawn and strengthen your center pawns.
Black castles kingside, bringing their king to safety.
Play Re1 to place your rook on the open e-file and increase pressure on the center.
